'''Heatmor''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''クイタラン''' ''Kuitaran'') is a {{type|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon.

==Biology==
Heatmor is a bipedal, anteater-like Pokémon. It has a beige face while the rest of its fur is red with yellow stripes sharing appearance of molten lava. On its lower abdomen, back, and underside are raised, beige colored bands which resemble pipes, leading to its tail. Its claws, on both its feet and hands, are a dull yellow and on its wrists are raised, dented bands; both the wrists and feet are beige-colored. Its tail is dented upward and has a hole in it, similar in appearance to a {{wp|muffler}}. It also seems to serve the same purpose as a muffler, being able to expel gases.

{{p|Durant}} are the preferred prey of Heatmor. Its [[Pokédex]] entry states that it burns through Durant's steel bodies with its tongue and consumes their insides. Heatmor is the only known Pokemon that can learn {{m|Fire Lash}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Manning Heatmor.png|thumb|250px|left|Heatmor in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Heatmor made its main series debut in ''[[BW077|Evolution by Fire!]]'', under the ownership of [[Shamus]]. It appeared alongside Shamus's {{p|Emboar}} in a [[Double Battle]] against [[Kylan]]'s {{p|Mienshao}} and {{p|Watchog}}. Shamus used it again, along with Emboar, in a Double Battle against {{Ash}}. They were able to defeat {{AP|Snivy}}, but lost to {{AP|Tepig}} when it evolved into {{p|Pignite}}.

A Heatmor appeared in ''[[BW090|Jostling for the Junior Cup!]]'', under the ownership of [[Manning]]. It was a participant of the [[Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup]]. Heatmor was able to defeat [[Kenton]]'s {{p|Golett}} and advance to the next round, but it quickly lost to [[Trip]] and his {{TP|Trip|Serperior}}.

===Minor appearances===
Heatmor debuted in a minor cameo in the opening sequence of ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom]]''.

A Heatmor appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

[[Dino]] owned a Heatmor, which appeared in ''[[BW108|A Unova League Evolution!]]'' in the scoreboard of the full battles in his battle against [[Virgil]].

A {{pkmn2|giant}} Heatmor appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]'', but as one of {{p|Zoroark}}'s {{a|illusion}}s.

Two Trainers' Heatmor appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Heatmor being the natural predator of {{p|Durant}} is reflected in their [[type]]s.
* Heatmor and its {{p|Durant|rival}} were designed by [[Ken Sugimori]].
* Heatmor and Durant have a lot of similarities. They share the same leveling rate, catch rate, hatch time, base experience yield, base stat total, and gender ratio.

===Origin===
Heatmor seems to be based on an {{wp|anteater}} with elements of {{wp|flamethrower}}s and {{wp|ironworks}}. Its wrists resemble {{wp|air filter}} intake inlets and its tail is similar to an engine's {{wp|muffler}}.

====Name origin====
Heatmor may be a combination of ''heat'' and ''armor'' (referring to the armored appearance of its fur) or ''{{wp|Mortar (weapon)|mortar}}'' (referring to its type and barrel-like arms). It may also be a play on ''eat more'', as in to "eat more {{p|Durant|ants}}."

Kuitaran may be a combination of アリクイ ''arikui'' (anteater) and ''anteater'', specifically the ''an'' and ''tar''. It may also be a play on 食い足らん ''kuitaran'' (has not eaten enough), similar to its English name.
